title: Leah Bracknell, ‘Emmerdale’ actress who played the first lesbian character to feature regularly in a British soap – obituary
text:
Leah Bracknell, who has died of cancer aged 55, played the vet Zoë Tate in ITV’s Yorkshire farming saga Emmerdale between 1989 and 2005, the first lesbian to feature regularly in a British soap.

She came out as gay on screen in 1993, a year before Beth Jordache (Anna Friel) bestowed her first lesbian kiss in Brookside on Channel 4. In May 1996 the doe-eyed Zoë arrived at the church for her same-sex wedding to Emma (Rachel Ambler), only to stop short at the door, smitten at the sight of her best woman and old flame Susie (Louise Heaney), the occasion ending in a three-way catfight.

“It was all about as likely to happen in a Yorkshire village as Geoff Boycott joining the local Morris Dancers,”...
description: Leah Bracknell, who has died of cancer aged 55, played the vet Zoë Tate in ITV’s Yorkshire farming saga Emmerdale between 1989 and 2005, the first lesbian to feature regularly in a British soap.
